Package greenmirror

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CommandLineOptionHandler
    The interface that encapsulates all command line argument handlers.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Command
    All commands that are sent over the network are wrapped in subclasses of this abstract class.
    CommandHandler
    A class that handles commands received over the network.
    FxPropertyWrapper
    A wrapper class for handling JavaFX properties.
    FxShapeWrapper
    A small extension of the FxWrapper class.
    FxWrapper
    A wrapper class for handling JavaFX nodes.
    FxWrapper.FadeTransition
    A Transition class that animates the change in opacity.
    FxWrapper.RotateTransition
    A Transition class that animates the change of the rotation.
    GreenMirrorController
    The base controller.
    GreenMirrorUtils
    An auxiliary class containing several simple methods.
    Log
    A simple singleton class handling the log.
    Node
    The class that models any node.
    Node.Identifier
    A class to generalize the use of the Node identifiers.
    NodeList
    A custom List extension to apply specific filters to a list of Node.
    NullNode
    A class to handle removed Nodes better.
    PeerListener
    A general class for listening to incoming data from a connected peer.
    Placement
    The Placement abstract class used for indicating where a Node should be placed relative to another Node.
    Relation
    A class to model relations between Nodes.
    RelationList
    A custom LinkedList>Relation< class providing specific filters.
    StoredBytesImage
    An extension of Image that also saves the bytes of the image itself in the Image object.
    WindowLogger
    A PrintStream that is used as a log window.
    WindowLogger.WindowOutputStream
    The OutputStream implementation that writes to the log window.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CommunicationFormat
    The available communication formats between the client and the server.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CommandHandler.DataParseException
    An Exception to indicate that the received data couldn't be parsed correctly.
    CommandHandler.MissingDataException
    An Exception to indicate that the received data is incomplete.
    CommandLineOptionHandler.FatalException
    An Exception thrown when validating or processing the argument gave an exception that prohibits the continuation of the application.
    NullNode.RemovedNodeUsedException
    An exception thrown when a removed node was used, which was impossible and essential.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    ClientSide
    An annotation to indicate that a class is meant to be used on the client side.
    ServerSide
    An annotation to indicate that a class is meant to be used on the server side.
